data.meta_description: Reissiger, Carl GottliebReissiger, Carl Gottlieb , noted German conductor and composer; b. Belzig, near Wittenberg, Jan. 31, 1798; d. Dresden, Nov. 7, 1859. His father, Christian Gottlieb Reissiger, was the Belzig organist and choirmaster. He studied piano and composition with Schicht at the Leipzig Thomasschule (1811–18), then theory with Salieri in Vienna (1821–22) and voice and composition with Winter in Munich (1822). Weber conducted the premiere of his opera Didone abbandonata at the Dresden Court Opera (Jan. 31, 1824). Source for information on Reissiger, Carl Gottlieb: Baker’s Biographical Dictionary of Musicians dictionary.
